clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Trial of Sintilimab Combined With Gemcitabine/Carboplatin Regimen in the Treatment of Advanced Primary Pulmonary Lymphoepithelioma-like Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: Exploratory Clinical Trial of Sintilimab Combined With Gemcitabine/Carboplatin Regimen in the Treatment of Advanced Primary Pulmonary Lymphoepithelioma-like Carcinoma（LELC）

brief_summary.textblock: The trial was designed to explore the safety and efficacy of sintilimab combined with gemcitabine and carboplatin in the treatment of advanced LELC.

primary_outcome.description: ORR was defined as the percentage of participants with confirmed objective tumor response, complete response (CR) or partial response (PR), as determined by investigator using RECIST v1.1 criteria

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the day the patient signs informed consent form until 30 days after last dose of sintilimab
primary_outcome.description: Safety will be assessed according to common terminology criteria for adverse events version 4.0 (CTC AE 4.0)

primary_outcome.measure: quality of life（the patient report outcome）
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the day the patient received treatment until 30 days after last dose of sintilimab
primary_outcome.description: Each patient answers to specific questions in questionnaire The time frame of most questions is "How would you rate your quality fo life during the last month"

intervention.intervention_name: Sintilimab combined with Gemcitabine and Carboplatin
intervention.description: The patients will received Gemcitabine1000mg/m2(d1,d8)(iv)+carboplatin AUC 5 (d1)(iv),4 cycles, Sintilimab 200 mg (3mg/kg when the weight <40kg ) (d1) (iv) in one cycle every 3 weeks, until PD or death. Radiological examinations (according to the RECIST 1.1 criteria) at baseline will be repeated for tumor response evaluation following every two cycles of chemotherapy. Patients will be followed up to 30 days after the last dose of study chemotherapy, and then every 3 months.
